WEBINAR OVERVIEW





With FERC's expanded enforcement scope and civil penalty authority under EPAct 2005 and the addition of mandatory reliability requirements developed by the ERO, energy industry companies are anxious about how the new enforcement regime will affect them.  

One thing is certain though. Under FERC's October 2005 Enforcement Policy, companies with formalized and effective compliance programs will not only be more likely to avoid violations, but if one occurs, will be in a position to potentially receive a reduced or even fully-mitigated civil penalty.
 

Registration - Single Site: $245.00


Registration - Additional Site: $150.00


This webinar will address the elements of an effective FERC compliance program, useful tools for implementing such a program, and how the compliance program successfully interfaces with other compliance processes already in place.  In addition, because a potential violation might even result in criminal charges, the speakers will focus on the special considerations of handling these matters.  To provide a broader perspective, the speakers will also address important lessons learned from designing analogous compliance programs in other highly regulated industries.  Finally, whether your company already has a compliance program or needs one, the webinar will conclude with strategies on how to assess the effectiveness of your current compliance capabilities.

Join the experts at Ballard Spahr for a 90-minute, comprehensive and practical discussion of how to develop and maintain an effective FERC compliance program
